Detailed Description

Represents an OBEX header.

OBEX headers consist of a Header identifier and the associated header data. The upper two bits of the 8-bit Header identifier specify the data type. Some headers are defined by the OBEX specification, but applications may additionally define their own headers.

It is not possible for applications to create instances of ObexHeader directly. Instead, the AddHeader method of class ObexHeaderList must be used. It is also not possible to modify header instances or delete them 'manually' - ObexHeader instances are immutable.

See also:
HeaderType - Data types supported by OBEX headers.

HeaderId - Header ID's of standard OBEX headers.

ObexHeaderList - List managing ObexHeader instances

enum ObexHeader::ByteOrder
 

Enumerator:
HostByteOrder  Native byte order of the local system.
ObexByteOrder  OBEX network byte order - BIG ENDIAN !

enum ObexHeader::HeaderType
 

Lists the data types supported by OBEX headers

Enumerator:
UnicodeType  Unicode text.
ByteSeqType  Octet string.
ByteType  Single byte integer (8 bits).
LongType  Quad byte integer (32 bits).

Member Function Documentation

UINT16 ObexHeader::GetSize (   )  const
 

Returns the size of the header value in octets.

ObexResult ObexHeader::PutValue (  UINT8  buffer[],
UINT16  size,
ByteOrder  format = ObexByteOrder
)  const
 

Serializes the header value into a flat octet string.

The method converts the header value into a flat octet stream. Conversion into target byte order is performed on the fly when required. When the buffer provided by the caller is not large enough to hold the output, it is left untouched and an error is returned.

Parameters:
buffer Buffer to hold the byte stream output, must be large enough to hold at least size bytes !
size Size of the buffer passed as 1st parameter (in octets).
format Output format to be produced by the function, the default is ObexByteOrder (big endian).
Returns:
ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' otherwise.

UINT8 ObexHeader::ToByte (   )  const
 

Returns the header value as a 8-bit unsigned integer.

Warning:Invoking this method when the header type is different from ByteType is illegal and will trigger an assertion !

const ByteBuffer & ObexHeader::ToByteBuffer (   )  const
 

Returns the header value as byte buffer.

Warning:Invoking this method when the header type is different from ByteSeqType is illegal and will trigger an assertion !

const CHAR* ObexHeader::ToCStr (   )  const
 

Returns the header value as string.

Note:This only makes sense when the header does not contain binary data (especially 0x00 bytes), otherwise the string will be truncated. Use ByteBuffer to work with binary data.

Warning:Invoking this method when the header type is different from ByteSeqType is illegal and will trigger an assertion !

UINT32 ObexHeader::ToLong (   )  const
 

Returns the header value as a 32-bit unsigned integer.

Warning:Invoking this method when the header type is different from LongType is illegal and will trigger an assertion !

const String ObexHeader::ToString (   )  const
 

Returns the header value as string.

Note:This only makes sense when the header does not contain binary data (especially 0x00 bytes), otherwise the string will be truncated. Use ByteBuffer to work with binary data.

Warning:Invoking this method when the header type is different from ByteSeqType is illegal and will trigger an assertion !

const WString & ObexHeader::ToWString (   )  const
 

Returns the header value as a Unicode string.

Warning:Invoking this method when the header type is different from UnicodeType is illegal and will trigger an assertion !
